CGSL-1.A.A.2-3|warning|Identifiers and names should follow recommended naming convention (1.A.A.2), and keywords in Verilog-HDL(IEEE1364), SystemVerilog(v3.1a), and keywords in VHDL(IEEE1076.X) must not be used (1.A.A.3).

	Warning|block|Invalid Industry identifier or keyword, found in S-Function block name 'Sine Wave' ; consider renaming it.|simulink_with_hdl/P1/Sine Wave

CGSL-1.A.A.4|message|Do not use names starting with VDD, VSS, VCC, GND or VREF.
	Message||Industry rules do not allow underscores in identifier '_rsvd'. Changing identifier to 'rsvd'.|

CGSL-1.A.A.9|message|Top-level module/entity and port names should be less than or equal to 16 characters in length and not be mixed-case.
	Message||Industry rules do not allow underscores in clock enable input name 'clk_enable'. Changing clock enable input name to 'clkenable'.|
	Message||Industry rules do not allow underscores in clock enable output name 'ce_out'. Changing clock enable output name to 'ceout'.|
	Warning|subsystem|Invalid Industry identifier or keyword, found in top-level output port name 'Out_P1_1'; consider renaming it.|simulink_with_hdl/P1
	Warning|subsystem|Invalid Industry identifier or keyword, found in top-level output port name 'Out_P1_2'; consider renaming it.|simulink_with_hdl/P1

CGSL-1.A.D.1|message|Package file name should be followed by "pac.vhd".
	Message||Industry rules require the package file name postfix to be '_pac'. Overriding user setting '_pkg'.|

CGSL-1.A.E.2|message|Clock, Reset, and Enable signals should follow recommended naming convention.
	Message||Industry rules require the primary reset port name to be 'resetx'. Overriding user setting 'reset'.|
